summary: the man who allegedly killed his neighbour was believed to be suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the horrendous murder in 2012 , a jury has heard . luigi costa , 71 , is accused of stomping on his elderly neighbour terrence freebody 's head , cutting his throat and stabbing him multiple times in the dining room of his home on mugga way in red hill , canberra on july 2012 . forensic psychiatrist professor paul mullen examined costa after the attack and believes there was evidence of the accused 's state of mind declining in the lead-up to the incident and also during the event , the abc reported .

aspect: - Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of killing his elderly neighbor Terrence Freebody in the dining room of his home on Mugga Way, Red Hill, Canberra in July 2012.
- Professor Paul Mullen examined Costa after the attack and believes there was evidence of his state of mind declining in the lead-up to the incident and also during the event.
- The forensic psychiatrist told the court that the triple 0 calls made by Costa during the incident suggest his mood fluctuated from moment to moment.
- Professor Mullin also said the trail of faeces from the crime scene to the toilet where police found Costa suggested his confused mental state.
- The prosecutor suggested that Costa feigned forgetfulness during an interview with Professor Mullin, which the psychiatrist denied.
- The jury can return a not guilty verdict if Costa's unstable mindset at time of the attack can be proven.
explain: Luigi Costa, an Italian citizen, is accused of stomping on his elderly neighbor Terrence Freebody's head, cutting his throat, and stabbing him multiple times in the dining room of his home on Mugga Way, Red Hill, Canberra in July 2012.

The aspect states that Professor Paul Mullen, after examining Costa after the attack, believes that there was evidence of his declining state of mind in both the lead-up to the incident and during the event. This highlights that Costa's mental health was not in a stable condition and may have contributed to the murder.

The forensic psychiatrist told the court that the triple 0 calls made by Costa during the incident suggest his mood fluctuated from moment to moment. 

This core idea indicates that the mental health state of Costa, who allegedly killed his neighbor, is unstable as he couldn't maintain a consistent mood during the incident.

The aspect mentioned highlights the confusion and mental decline of the accused, Luigi Costa, during the murder of his elderly neighbor. This can be inferred from the trail of feces found from the crime scene to the toilet where he was found by the police.
The prosecutor suggested that Costa was not truthful with Professor Mullin during their interview, and that he was faking forgetfulness.

If the jury accepts that Costa was suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the murder, he may be found not guilty as his unstable mindset at the time of the attack will be considered as a mitigating factor.
